item.title: Brian add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "No art is possible without a dance with death." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Brian add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "There is one purpose to life and one only: to bear witness to and understand as much as possible of the complexity of the world- its beauty, its mysteries, its riddles." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Brian add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "What is man? He's just a collection of chemicals with delusions of grandeur." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Brian add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Brian add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious - the fundamental emotion which stands at the cradle of true art and true science." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Brian add a quote by Wilhelm Stekel
item.description: "The mark of the immature man is that he wants to die nobly for a cause, while the mark of the mature man is that is wants to live humbly for one." -- Wilhelm Stekel

item.title: Brian add a quote by Dalton Trumbo
item.description: "What's so noble about being dead?" -- Dalton Trumbo

item.title: Brian add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Brian add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda
